termsAndConditions.content:
1. Welcome to iVOTE!
Thank you for using the iVOTE Automated Election System (the “Website”). By using the website, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms and Conditions. If you disagree with all the terms and conditions governing your use of iVOTE, please refrain from using the website immediately.

2. Definitions
This section defines key terms used throughout the Terms and Conditions to provide clarity within the context of this Website:

• “Website”: The iVOTE Automated Election System website.
• “User”: Any individual who accesses and uses the Website.
• “Student Voter”: A student at Polytechnic University of the Philippines – Santa Rosa Campus who registers to vote in student academic organization elections.
• “Head Admin”: An individual with the highest level of administrative control over the Website, including the ability to add Admin accounts.
• “Admin”: An individual with administrative control over the Website, subordinate to the Head Admin.
• “Certificate of Registration”: A document provided by the student that verifies their current enrollment status and eligibility to vote in their student academic organization.

User Accounts and Obligations
The following are responsibilities and expected behaviors that users are required to adhere to when using the Website:

Student Voters are required to register accurately and adhere to responsible conduct guidelines.

Head Admin adds Admin accounts, approves registrations, manages election processes, and accesses system-generated election reports.

Admin assists with registrations, manages voter accounts, supports election operations, and accesses system-generated election reports.



3. Election Reports
The Website can generate election reports in PDF format. All election reports generated by the Website are considered valid and do not require signatures, as they are system-generated. Users with the appropriate permissions (Head Admin and Admin) can download these reports.

4. Intellectual Property
The development team retains all intellectual property rights to the content and materials available on the Website. Users are granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the content for personal, non-commercial purposes only. You agree not to reproduce or distribute the content in any way, including electronically or via registration of any new trademarks, trade names, or service marks without express written permission.

5. Exclusion of Liability
The Website is provided “as is” without any warranties, express, or implied. The development team does not guarantee that the Website will be error-free or uninterrupted. The development team is not liable for any damages arising from the use or inability to use the Website.

6. User-Generated Content
Users are responsible for the content they submit, including registration information and documents. The development team reserves the right to remove any inappropriate or non-compliant content. By submitting the content, users grant the development team a license to use, display, and distribute the content as necessary for the operation of the Website.

7. Termination
The development team reserves the right to terminate any account or access to the Website for violations of these Terms. Upon termination, the user’s access to the Website and any submitted content will be revoked. If you wish to terminate your account, you may simply discontinue using the Website.

8. Changes to Terms
The development team reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time at our sole discretion without notice.

9. Contact Information
For questions or assistance, please contact the development team at ivote-pupsrc@gmail.com.

privacyPolicy.content:
The iVOTE Automated Election System complies fully with Republic Act No. 10173, also known as the Data Privacy Act of 2012, ensuring the protection and security of personal data submitted through the website for organizational elections.

Data is collected through forms when users submit forms and documents to the development team, including email addresses and Certificates of Registration (COR) used for voter registration and verification.

Personal data is collected solely to facilitate fair and transparent elections at Polytechnic University of the Philippines – Santa Rosa Campus, encompassing voter registration, transfer to other student organizations, and election administration.

Technical and organizational measures are implemented to safeguard personal data against unauthorized access or disclosure.

For questions or assistance, please contact the development team at ivote-pupsrc@gmail.com.
